text.name: sys_description
text.text: The PC-Engine GT or Turbo GT (called TurboExpress in the United States) is a portable console manufactured by NEC in 1991. It is actually a portable PC-Engine equipped with a color LCD screen with active matrix 6.6 centimeters. It is capable of running all games of the PCE and the rendering on its screen is sumptuous, it remained for a long time the most powerful of portable consoles far ahead of the Lynx, Game Boy and GameGear. Its only faults are in fact its autonomy, 6 LR6 batteries for only 3 hours of play, and a weight greater than that of the Game Boy of 435 grams.
